name: Zhao Wei
description:
'''Zhao Wei''' ({{Lang-zh|c=|p=Zhào Wēi|s=赵薇|t=趙薇}}; born 12 March 1976), also known as '''Vicky''' or '''Vicki Zhao''', is a [[Chinese nationality law|Chinese]] actress, singer, filmmaker, and businesswoman. Regarded as one of China's [[Four Dan Actresses]], she rose to fame for her role in the television series ''[[My Fair Princess]]'' (1998–1999), followed by such popular dramas and films as ''[[Romance in the Rain]]'' (2001), ''[[Shaolin Soccer]]'' (2001), ''[[Moment in Peking (2005 TV series)|Moment in Peking]]'' (2005), ''[[Painted Skin (2008 film)|Painted Skin]]'' (2008), ''[[Mulan (2009 film)|Mulan]]'' (2009), ''[[Dearest (2014 film)|Dearest]]'' (2014), for which she won the [[Hong Kong Film Award for Best Actress]], ''[[Lost in Hong Kong]]'' (2015) and ''[[Tiger Mom (TV series)|Tiger Mom]]'' (2015). Zhao made her directorial debut with ''[[So Young (film)|So Young]]'' (2013), which is a commercial and critical success. She is also a singer with 7 albums and the second largest shareholder of [[Alibaba Pictures]]. Zhao ranked 80th on [[Forbes China Celebrity 100|''Forbes'' China Celebrity 100]] list in 2013, 22nd in 2014, 7th in 2015, and 28th in 2017. 

Since 27 August 2021, Zhao has been blacklisted by the [[Government of China|Chinese government]], with most content featuring her removed from the Chinese Internet.
